body_text.text: Introduction
The Beijing Electron Collider has been upgraded (BEPCII) to a double ring collider with a design luminosity of 1 × 10 33 cm −2 s −1 at a center-of-mass energy of 3.78GeV.
It is operating between 2.0 and 4.6 GeV in the center of mass.
The BESIII experiment will be used to study the charm and τ physics.
It is foreseen to collect on the order of 10 billion J/ψ events or 3 billion ψ(2S) events per year according to the designed luminosity.
About 32 million DD pairs and 2.0 million D S D S at threshold will be collected per year [1,2].
In last summer, the peak luminosity of BEPCII had reached 3.2 × 10 32 cm −2 s −1 , while, it reaches 5.2 × 10 32 cm −2 s −1 during this winter running on the ψ(3770) peak.
During 2009, BESIII acquired a sample of 106 M ψ ′ events, or four times the CLEOc sample, and about 226 M J/ψ events, or about four times the BESII J/ψ sample.
Results in this paper are based on these data sets.
In 2010, about 910 pb −1 integrated luminosity was collected on the peak of ψ(3770).
Now BESIII is still taking data on the peak of ψ(3770), we expect another 1.5 pb −1 luminosity will be ready this summer.
We report on the charm physics potential at the BESIII experiment which will make significant contribution to quark flavor physics this decade.
The charm physics program includes studies of leptonic, semileptonic, hadronic charm decays, and tests for physics beyond the Standard Model.
High precision charm data will enable us to validate forthcoming Lattice QCD calculations at the few percent level.
These can then be used to make precise measurements of CKM elements,
Results for charmonium physics

In 2005, CLEOc [4] reported a measurement of the mass of the P-wave charmonium spinsinglet state h c in e + e − → ψ ′ → π 0 h c , h c → γη c , in which they used both inclusive and exclusive η c decay events.
In 2008, they repeated their analysis with 25 M ψ ′ events [5].
Combining results, they obtained m(h c ) AV G = 3525.2 ± 0.18 ± 0.12 MeV/c 2 [5].
A precise determination of the mass is important to learn about the hyperfine (spin-spin) interaction of P wave states [6].

The h c state is also studied at BESIII with 106 M ψ(2S) events accumulated in 2009 [7].
Clear signals are observed for ψ(2S) → π 0 h c with and without the subsequent radiative decay h c → γη c .
The absolute branching ratios B(ψ(2S) → π 0 h c ) = (8.4 ± 1.3 ± 1.0) × 10 −4 and B(h c → γη c ) = (54.3 ± 6.7 ± 5.2)% are determined for the first time.
The width for h c state is determined to be Γ(h c ) < 1.44 MeV at the 90% C.L..
Measurements of M(h c ) = 3525.40 ± 0.13 ± 0.18 MeV and B(ψ ′ → π 0 h c ) × B(h c → γη c ) = (4.58 ± 0.40 ± 0.50) × 10 −4 are consistent with previous results by CLEOc [4].
BESIII has studied ψ ′ → γ χ cJ , χ cJ → π 0 π 0 and ηη, where π 0 and η decay to γγ [8].
These results are consistent with CLEOc measurements within error [9].
Improved measurements will allow refinement of theory [10].

body_text.section: Potential of charm physics at BESIII

body_text.text: BESIII will not be able to compete both BABAR and Belle in statistics on charm physics, especially on the rare and forbidden decays of charm mesons.

body_text.text: However, data taken at charm threshold still have powerful advantages over the data at ϒ(4S), which we list here [17]:

body_text.text: Summary
Results have been presented based on BESIII samples of 106 M ψ ′ and about 226 J/ψ events.
Many more results are to be expected in the future.
In addition, BESIII acquired nearly 1 f b −1 of data at the ψ(3770) resonance in 2010, including approximately 75pb −1 of scan data around the ψ(3770) peak.
BESIII is still running at the ψ(3770) peak in 2011.
We expect another 1.5 fb −1 luminosity will be collected next summer.

Decays of the ψ(3770) produce quantum correlated DD pairs, which are ideal for mixing and CP violation studies, as well measurements of absolute branching fractions and studies of semi-leptonic decays.
This sample allows BESIII to begin their charm physics program.
